notesStmt.note: Leaves have been excised throughout; very small stubs remain
De Ricci, Seymour, with the assistance of W. J. Wilson, Census of Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the United States and Canada, vol. 2 (New York,: H. W. Wilson, 1935-40), p. 2042, no. 98.

Free Library of Philadelphia, A Descriptive Catalogue of the John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts in the Free Library of Philadelphia, compiled by Edwin Wolf, 2nd, with an introduction by Dr. A.S.W. Rosenbach (Philadelphia: The Free Library, 1937), p. 131, no. 117 (+ Supplement).

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This manuscript contains a Book of Hours, Use of Rome. Leaves have been excised throughout.

msItem.title: Book of Hours, Use of Rome

supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in crayon, upper corner recto

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled in ink; one column of eleven lines; written area: 51x40 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Seven four-line illuminated initials; six historiated illuminated initials with full-page borders; one-line and two-line initials in red and blue throughout; two-line initials decorated with pen flourishes in red or blue; rubrication throughout; one full-page illuminated miniature of the Virgin and Child enthroned
[Flyleaf 1 recto]Prayer to St. Anthony of Padua on a flyleaf in a 16th century hand
15rSix line historiated initial D, Saint Anthony of Padua

binding.p: Early nineteenth-century black morocco, in blue morocco case

history.provenance: John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia; given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936

keywords.term: Illumination of books and manuscripts, Gothic
